Sentencas: Solid oxide fuel cells (SOFCs) have the potential to meet the critical energy needs of our modern civilization and minimize the adverse environmental impacts from excessive energy consumption.
Titulo: Modeling of Solid Oxide Fuel Cells with Particle Size and Porosity Grading in Anode Electrode

Sentencas: They are highly efficient, clean, and can run on variety of fuel gases.
Titulo: Modeling of Solid Oxide Fuel Cells with Particle Size and Porosity Grading in Anode Electrode

Sentencas: However, little investigative focus has been put on optimal power output based on electrode microstructure.
Titulo: Modeling of Solid Oxide Fuel Cells with Particle Size and Porosity Grading in Anode Electrode

Sentencas: In this work, a complete electrode polarization model of SOFCs has been developed and utilized to analyze the performance of functionally graded anode with different particle size and porosity profiles.
Titulo: Modeling of Solid Oxide Fuel Cells with Particle Size and Porosity Grading in Anode Electrode

Sentencas: The model helps to understand the implications of varying the electrode microstructure from the polarization standpoint.
Titulo: Modeling of Solid Oxide Fuel Cells with Particle Size and Porosity Grading in Anode Electrode

Sentencas: The work identified conditions when grading can improve the cell performance and showed that grading is not always beneficial or necessary.
Titulo: Modeling of Solid Oxide Fuel Cells with Particle Size and Porosity Grading in Anode Electrode
